Had it been a typical year, they would have been honored at AISD's annual employee banquet. The theme this year would have been Ar√™te. This is a Greek word which means excellence, valor and virtue. post_text: The SpaceX launch reminds us of Amarillo ISD's strong connections to the space program, like astronauts Paul Lockhart and the late Rick Husband, both graduates of AISD schools. But today, we're especially thinking of NASA's Chief Flight Director Holly Ridings. Holly is a graduate of Tasocsa High School. We caught up with her last year when she was inducted into the THS Hall of Fame and offered this advice to students. "Find something where you can make a difference," said Ridings. "Each one of you has a superpower. Find the best place to use your superpower." Holly is back in the news this week with this out-of-this-world write up in Air & Space Magazine.

post_text: As you are probably now aware, Texas Governor Greg Abbott has ordered all Texas schools to close for two weeks. The order takes effect from midnight March 20 until midnight April 3. Amarillo ISD leaders are busy adjusting plans we had already begun developing for next week. Those plans will include opportunities for students who need meals to receive them and providing continued instruction for students at home through paper and online platforms. The governing body over school districts, the Texas Education Agency, has instructed school to continue with instruction for students, but obviously, it will look different than ever before. With the announcement of this executive order, many things are unclear for school districts like AISD, but we are seeking guidance from the state and we will be communicating more info in the coming days as it becomes available.Visit www.amaisd.org/covid19 for updates and more information from the District.
